moved everything to Airlang tested on local, not on heroku yet Need to associate a offline repertory to push it to
moved everything to Airlang tested on local, not on heroku yet Need to associate a offline repertory to push it to
moved everything to Airlang tested on local, not on heroku yet Need to associate a offline repertory to push it to

correcting some debug displaying bugs (now that there is a trace module, no need for LogEntry, that was duplicating things) also there was one lost LogEntry without a LogExit also set a name for proxy function when tracing to keep same function name - that was causing inconsistencies, but I had to renounce prefixing by module name for now correcting a bug with acth reduce of actions, due to the wrong name of proxy functions

refactored querieson server side to use rsvp promises queries are now registered in a registry that allow to reuse the same code for each query a bunch of parameters are type-checked. Maybe I should use one of those node module for parameter checking (cf. schemata?) or write it myself?

refactor filter main functions to move many config to DS, all prefixed by filter Improved documentation of filter function in RM module, in particular the config parameters changed the signature of the filter function to include tokenizer and detokenizer (mandatory arguments for now, the same for all filters) Updated thetests in tes_reader models Some more testing to do For example, now, if a data adapter is called with input type and output type being the same, the identifty function is returned
added testing for overlapping filter functionalities

set mocha as test framework for server side testing main reason is that it is integrated in webstorm However there seems to be some incongruities as per asynchronous testing, in conjunction with promises Also refactor common code for execution of queries and processing of results
added some test for the HTML parsing functions Starting to add it to the highlighting function

corrected bugs for parsing function and created associated test and created a wrapper function for easier async test with QUnit Remains to have only one call to the parser instead of one call for each div

excellent day. Foiund a way to do cross-origin request. Via a jquery plugin though. Also dealt with the ... case when splitting for sentence counting (detail) also put again the formatting of the title, somehow took me 3-4 hours... Don't forget to remove the global variables I have put many places in the code (cf. //TEST CODE)
rmoved some global aPromise debugging code from main
test suite for checking against the word counting when clicking on a word - so far only the second part from the parent with id to the clicked word
change a function declaration to make it work with firefox. Function must b declared before usage in Firefox, not a problem in Chrome apparetnly
split tests in two test files, one for helper functions , one for functionalities in progress tested tree traversal of DOM
completed test and corrected bug with which word was not correctly returned
highlighting seems to be woking, now going to work on a simplified version of apply filter
corrected bug for notes changed the filtering mechanism - no commenting now
added an ssert type for type checking of function! it even allows to test for instanceof and go up the prototype chain for the checking
improved assert_type function started to add backend storage for notes but still in early stage
corrected a bug with rpc_socket , now reader model module i initialized in main function which plays the role of the shell

lots of things I forget but bvasically now notes can be added and retrieved from database storage so on server side added some abstraction to handle remote storage on client side added a stateful module and using now rsvp promises instead of jquery

corrected a b ig mistake a the cost of always storing text word by word. All filters must apply on the same array length so we used the word by word thing in all filters. A neater solution would be to enforce that at parsing instead of after to avoid errors.
some cleaning up of code, removing out-of-date todos
added part of the notes storge functionality with the weights, so many bugs with promises and types....
not TESTED yet, but finished the part of getting the next word to revise
corrected some bugs added EXO view template
just saving a long day of work
some changes in the translate controllerand I don't know what else oh yeah the state machine for sleecting word to memorize is working now - but I have to introduce the word translations
some changes in the translate controllerand I don't know what else oh yeah the state machine for sleecting word to memorize is working now - but I have to introduce the word translations
The The note functionality is now almost working in conjunction with the showing the translation Remains to store not the word but the lemma. This implies subtle changes in the logic
some corrections, refactoring of utils, now dismissing the window after including the note
refactored, and added table for translation
corrected some bugs, improved communication between controllers, now using exercise_type of 1 instead of undefined still have to fill in the word_translation_user table
